intro: Dorstenia tubicina f. subexcentrica, commonly known as the "spider plant" or "tropical spider plant," is a unique member of the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, curling bracts that resemble the legs of a spider, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white in color. It thrives in warm, humid environments and is often cultivated as a decorative plant due to its unusual appearance. This form is a variant of the species, distinguished by its slightly elongated and more spread-out bracts.
